title: .NET Documentation
description: .NET is a free, cross-platform, open-source developer platform for building many kinds of applications including web, mobile, desktop, games, IoT, and AI. This documentation covers the .NET runtime, languages (C#, F#, Visual Basic), core libraries, and tooling. Current stable release: .NET 10 (November 2025). Current LTS release: .NET 8.
shortDescription: Cross-platform development for web, mobile, desktop, games, IoT, and AI.

guidance.title: Guidance for AI Assistants
items: **Target .NET 10** (LTS) for new projects. .NET 8 and .NET 9 both reach end-of-support on November 10, 2026 - users on these versions should plan migration to .NET 10.

**C# language versions**: .NET 10 uses C# 14, .NET 9 uses C# 13, and .NET 8 uses C# 12. Each .NET major version increments the default C# version by one. Use `<LangVersion>` in project files to override.
**Use Microsoft.Extensions.AI** for AI integration rather than provider-specific SDKs directly.
**Check What's New and Breaking Changes** when users are upgrading between major versions.
**Prefer modern patterns**: top-level statements, file-scoped namespaces, primary constructors, and collection expressions.
**For web APIs**, use Minimal APIs for simple services or controllers for larger applications.
**For dependency injection**, use the built-in `Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection` container.
**Topic counts** indicate total reachable content in that subtree, not file size. Each llms.txt file is a lightweight index (~2-8KB) containing links and summaries.
